Title: Chiral oscillations in quantum field theory
Summary: The paper discusses chiral oscillations in Dirac particles using a quantum field theory approach, drawing parallels to flavor mixing and oscillations, especially in neutrinos.

Title: Bounds on the minimum sound speed above neutron star densities
Summary: The study establishes upper bounds on the sound speed of ultra-dense matter in neutron stars, linking it to their maximum mass and QCD properties.

Title: On Nucleon "Radii"
Summary: The study critiques the geometric interpretations of nucleon radii and describes the gluon cloud's role in nucleon-nucleon interactions at high energy.

Title: Cold Quark Matter: Renormalization Group Improvement at next-to-next-to leading order
Summary: The work discusses an improved calculation of QCD pressure at zero temperature and baryonic densities using renormalization group optimized perturbation theory.

Title: Measurement of the Decay $Ξ^{0}\toΛγ$ with Entangled $Ξ^{0}\barΞ^{0}$ Pairs
Summary: The study measures the decay of \\Xi^{0} to \\Lambda\\gamma, determining its branching fraction and decay asymmetry, providing insights into weak radiative hyperon decays.

Title: Study of the rare decay $J/ψ\to μ^+μ^-μ^+μ^-$
Summary: The study reports the observation and measurement of the rare decay J/ψ → μ⁺μ⁻μ⁺μ⁻ using LHCb data, with branching fraction determined.

Title: Flavor Dependence of Charged Pion Fragmentation Functions
Summary: The study measures flavor-dependent multiplicities for pi^+ and pi^- production in SIDIS to investigate charge symmetry violation in fragmentation functions.
Keywords: ['pion fragmentation', 'charge symmetry violation', 'semi-inclusive deep-inelastic scattering', 'flavor dependence']

Title: Distinguishing the sources of dielectron anisotropic flow at low beam energies
Summary: The study analyzes dielectron anisotropic flow in heavy-ion collisions, focusing on distinguishing contributions from baryonic and mesonic resonances using different measurement methods.
Keywords: ['dielectron flow', 'heavy-ion collisions', 'anisotropic flow', 'scalar product method', 'baryonic resonances', 'mesonic resonances']

Title: Strange stars admixed with dark matter: equiparticle model in a two fluid approach
Summary: This work investigates strange stars mixed with dark matter using a quark model and explores stable configurations with fermionic and bosonic dark matter.

Title: AAK24: Global QCD analysis on polarized parton distribution in the presence of $A_2$ asymmetry measurements
Summary: The work presents a NLO QCD analysis focusing on polarized parton distribution functions using recent experimental data, emphasizing the role of semi-inclusive measurements.

Title: On the Schwinger effect during axion inflation
Summary: The work revisits Schwinger pair-production during axion inflation, improving predictions for gauge-field production efficiency and energy densities.

Title: Electromagnetic responses of a nonextensive quark-gluon plasma
Summary: The study investigates electromagnetic properties of a nonextensive quark-gluon plasma using kinetic theory to derive gluon self-energies and related indices.

Title: Gravitational waves from thermal heavy scalar dark matter
Summary: The study presents a scalar dark matter candidate with a mass of 1-10 TeV and its implications for gravitational wave signals from phase transitions.

Title: Event-activity-dependent beauty-baryon enhancement in simulations with color junctions
Summary: The study explores the enhancement of beauty baryon-to-meson production ratios in LHC data, examining event activity and color reconnection models.

Title: Analysis of the semileptonic $B_c\to D_s^*μ^+ μ^-$ decay mode in the effective field theory approach
Summary: The study explores the exclusive semileptonic decay $B_c\\to D_s^{*}\\mu^+ \\mu^-$ using Effective Field Theory, predicting observables and branching ratios amidst potential new physics.
Keywords: ['semileptonic decay', 'Effective Field Theory', 'branching ratio', 'new physics', 'B_c', 'D_s*', 'b to s transition']

Title: Future targets for light gauge bosons from cosmic strings
Summary: The study explores gauge boson production and gravitational wave emission from cosmic strings, examining their implications for dark matter and future observatories.

Title: Premerger phenomena in neutron-star binary coalescences
Summary: The presentation reviews premerger events in neutron-star mergers, focusing on their implications for astrophysics and the neutron-star equation of state.

Title: Model-independent determination of the strong-phase difference between $D^0$ and $\bar{D}^0 \to π^+π^-π^+π^-$ decays
Summary: This study measures the strong-phase difference in $D^0$ and $\bar{D}^0$ decays using quantum-correlated $D\bar{D}$ mesons, providing insights into $C\!P$ violation in $B$ meson decays.

Title: Cosmological Stasis from a Single Annihilating Particle Species: Extending Stasis Into the Thermal Domain
Summary: This work explores how a single annihilating particle species can lead to cosmological stasis even in thermal environments, extending previous findings.

Title: Upgrading the existing Haloscope-type detector for sensitive axion detection
Summary: The presentation discusses an upgrade to Haloscope-type detectors to enhance axion detection sensitivity using a transverse rf modulated magnetic field.

Title: Development and Implementation of Advanced Beam Diagnostic and Abort Systems in SuperKEKB
Summary: The talk discusses the development of advanced beam diagnostics and abort systems to address Sudden Beam Loss events at SuperKEKB, aiming to enhance operational stability.
